garmin_premium.calculation: Unlimited weather requests - no marginal cost per forecast

zoleo_basic.calculation: 75 messages for $20 = $0.27/message if used exclusively for weather (realistic: higher due to other messaging needs)

zoleo_in_touch.calculation: 300 messages for $35 = $0.12/message if used exclusively for weather (realistic: higher due to other messaging needs)

zoleo_unlimited.calculation: Unlimited weather requests - no marginal cost per forecast

thunderbird.calculation: $29.99 provides 90 forecasts = $0.33 per forecast. No device cost ($0 vs $350-450 for inReach/ZOLEO). No subscription - prepay credits only.

thunderbird_advantages.multi_point_trail_forecast: Neither competitor offers multi-waypoint forecasts in a single request. Garmin allows manual waypoint selection but each costs a message. ZOLEO only supports current location or single custom location.
thunderbird_advantages.altitude_aware: Neither competitor adjusts forecasts for elevation. This is a documented complaint in Garmin forums and outdoor community discussions.
thunderbird_advantages.zero_marginal_cost_for_receiving: Thunderbird forecasts arrive as inbound SMS via satellite - no message burned from plan allowance. Competitors charge per weather request (Garmin: $0.50 on Enabled, counts as message on other plans; ZOLEO: counts as 1 message on Basic/In Touch plans).
thunderbird_advantages.push_not_pull: Scheduled delivery vs requiring hiker to actively request. Thunderbird can deliver forecasts at pre-scheduled times without user interaction.
thunderbird_advantages.no_extra_device: Works on existing smartphone via satellite SMS (iPhone 14+, Android with Starlink D2C). No $350-450 dedicated hardware purchase required.
thunderbird_advantages.no_monthly_subscription: One-time credit purchase ($29.99 for 90 forecasts) vs monthly recurring fees ($7.99-50/mo for Garmin, $20-50/mo for ZOLEO) even when not hiking.
thunderbird_advantages.higher_resolution_data: Thunderbird uses highest resolution data from official national weather services with hourly updates. Competitors use commercial aggregators (Forecast.io, OCENS, Xweather) with lower resolution.
thunderbird_advantages.more_metrics: 12 important metrics including cloud base and freezing level - critical for alpine safety. Competitors provide basic metrics only (temp, wind, precip, pressure).
thunderbird_advantages.gpx_integration: Upload GPX file and get forecasts for all waypoints along trail. Competitors require manual coordinate entry for each point.
thunderbird_advantages.community_trails: Access community-uploaded GPX files for popular trails. Competitors have no trail database.
